app.name: iloom
app.one_sentence: A developer workflow system delivered as a CLI and VS Code extension for structured AI-assisted development that persists analysis, plans, and decisions to your issue tracker.

core_loop: Developers use the iloom CLI to start tasks, generate code with AI agents, review artifacts, create draft PRs with full issue context, and manage hierarchical workflows, while the VS Code extension provides real-time visibility into AI decisions, risks, and assumptions.

screens.name: Main Workflow Screen
screens.purpose: Orchestrate AI-assisted development tasks including planning, implementation, and review within isolated workflows.
primary_actions: Start a new task with `il start`
List project issues and PRs with `il issues`
Review and manage active looms via VS Code extension

rust_commands.name: il_start
rust_commands.purpose: Initiate a new AI-assisted development task, optionally creating a draft PR with linked issue context.

rust_commands.name: il_issues
rust_commands.purpose: List open issues and non-draft pull requests from configured issue trackers (GitHub or Linear), with caching for performance.

rust_commands.name: il_cleanup
rust_commands.purpose: Clean up local branches associated with completed or obsolete looms without failing on draft PR branches.

rust_commands.name: il_vscode
rust_commands.purpose: Install and manage the iloom VS Code extension to enable real-time AI insight panels and loom exploration.

tasks: Implement core CLI commands: `il start`, `il issues`, `il cleanup`
Integrate draft PR creation with issue context embedding
Build local caching layer for issue/PR metadata
Enable VS Code extension installation via `il vscode`

acceptance_tests: User can run `il start` on an unconfigured project and accept sensible defaults with one keypress.
Running `il issues` lists open GitHub/Linear issues and non-draft PRs, caches results for 2 minutes, and prefixes PRs with [PR].
Draft PRs created during `il start` include full issue title, body, and 'Fixes #XXX' keyword for auto-closure on merge.
Child loom draft PRs correctly target the parent loom's branch instead of main to support stacked PR workflows.
The `il cleanup` command successfully deletes local branches even when associated with draft PRs.
open_questions: How should artifact review severity levels map to required human intervention?
What is the optimal cache invalidation strategy for issue tracker data across team members?
Can JiraWiki formatting inconsistencies in issue comments be fully resolved through normalization?
